Data: Lee to Perera, 3 runs starts a fraction too straight, clipped off the legs easily and they run three well
Lee to Jayasuriya, 1 run pitched up on off and tucked out for a single
Lee to Perera, no run ripper delivery - literally, it ripped straight past the outside edge as the batsman plays forward on the front foot down the channel... and misses
Lee to Perera, 1 run some encouraging swing as the ball goes down the off-side, and is helped on its way with a push off the back foot to third man
Lee to Jayasuriya, no run stays over the wicket to the left hander and nearly has him chopping on as Jayasuriya cuts off the back foot back and the inside edge crashes past the leg stump

Lee to Jayasuriya, FOUR runs outside off and Jayasuriya scintillates as he lifts the ball from a good length up and over extra cover, the ball goes soaring and lands just inside the rope, two bounces and it's four
Bracken to Perera, 1 run in he runs, his self-proclaimed designer hair bobbing in the breeze, and the batsman plays out and they have to hurry through
Bracken to Jayasuriya, no run short ball outside off, cut down to the man at gully off the back foot
Bracken to Jayasuriya, no run tidy ball down off, good length and some encouraging carry through to the keeper, the batsman shouldering arms
Bracken to Jayasuriya, no run through the channel again down off
Bracken to Jayasuriya, 1 run cuts in from outside off on a good length, Jayasuriya pushes down in front of him, no more than a defence really, and they run through quickly. Good running
Bracken to Perera, no run a fuller delivery, right up there on off, defended on the front foot right in front of the stumps
Lee to Jayasuriya, no run short ball in line with off, defended off the back foot into the track
Lee to Jayasuriya, no run fired hard across him, and he gets in a tangle as he tries to force the ball off the back foot to cover, it clatters down on him and he looks for the single

Lee to Jayasuriya, 1 run now, you shouldn't laugh but everyone else is, even Perera as he runs through for Jayasuriya's push-and-run, Lee runs out to get the ball and Perera trips over him, loses his bat, tries to grope his way forward and just about gets his hand ba
Lee to Perera, no run pushed outside off on a good length with some vicious wobble (if that's not an oxymoron, wobbles always seem so harmless)
Lee to Perera, no run more of the same, the batsman wise enough to leave on both occasions
Lee to Perera, no run and a similar kind of ball, at 152.7kph, to end a good - and certainly entertaining - over

Bracken to Jayasuriya, no run gottim! Hasn't gottim! Bracken rolls his fingers on one of his favourite cutters, the ball pitches outside off, comes back in a long way off the seam and catches the pad on its way through
Bracken to Jayasuriya, no run defended on the front foot this time
Bracken to Jayasuriya, no run finds a good length, and a good width too, the ball defended on the front foot outside off
Bracken to Jayasuriya, no run pushes this one flat down the channel, good carry through to the keeper and the batsman leaves it serenely
Bracken to Jayasuriya, no run again Bracken gives nothing away, defended on the front foot tightly, not much else could be done there
Bracken to Jayasuriya, no run more of the good line'n'length, he's churning them out by the hat-load, and again it's defended on the front foot
Lee to Perera, no run hey now, Lee is pitch perfect with his gleaming bouncer which would have clattered into the helmet were the batsman not quick enough to duck under
Lee to Perera, no run defended now, Lee quickly into his groove
Lee to Perera, no run a shout got stuck in his throat there as the ball, at 153kph, cut in from in line with off and would have crashed down leg
Lee to Perera, OUT but he's got him this time...with a slower ball, a yorker which ducks in low and in line with middle, zooms under the bat and traps him plumb
Lee to Sangakkara, no run defended on the front foot first up
Lee to Sangakkara, no run lets that one go through, a leave in other words, to a decent length one outside off
Bracken to Jayasuriya, 1 run the ball comes in at 131kph, and an inside edge turns down behind him
Bracken to Sangakkara, no run outside off, Sangakkara rocks back into the line and defends straight back down with a ramrod-straight bat
Bracken to Sangakkara, no run outside off, pushed back down off the back foot into the covers
Bracken to Sangakkara, no run pushed through outside off, a tight line, some good rise and it's as much as the batsman can do to leave the ball
Bracken to Sangakkara, no run another good delivery, outside off and Sangakkara goes fishing, Bracken planting the bait on the rise, and the batsman only just to say fails to connect
Bracken to Sangakkara, no run Sangakkara breathes a bit easier this ball, letting that one fly through, but again on a good length

Lee to Jayasuriya, SIX runs Jayasuriya goes high and wide with a flashing outside edge down to deep third man, Hopes takes the catch but steps over at the same time, hardly his fault, there was nothing else he could have done there
Lee to Jayasuriya, FOUR runs a touch of width outside off, and Jayasuriya walks into a flashing cover-drive that takes just the one bounce before carrying over the line
Lee to Jayasuriya, no run hardly time to get his breath back, but we all take a breather with this one as the ball comes in on a good length in front of off and it's defended forward
Lee to Jayasuriya, 1 run the rollercoaster sets off again as he waits outside off and then frees his arms with a masterfully gentle steer down off the back foot behind point
Lee to Sangakkara, no run a good-length delivery in line with off and Sangakkara defends forward
Lee to Sangakkara, no run aims for the yorker, directly slightly outside off, and Sangakkara creeps up behind the ball and surprises it with a drive to cover, where it's picked up with ease
Bracken to Jayasuriya, 1 run outside off, more than enough width for Jayasuriya to lash a back-foot late cut up and over third man

Bracken to Sangakkara, 1 run responds well with a tight one up on middle, pushed out and they scramble through as Bracken does his best soccer player impression, nearly dribbling on to the posts at the striker's end, but just wide. Goal kick
Bracken to Jayasuriya, no run Bracken pushes outside off and the batsman is tempted, dangerously so, into coming out and playing at it, the ball leaps on naughtily, giggling to itself
Bracken to Jayasuriya, no run a good line and length, this time prompting a defence on the front foot
Bracken to Jayasuriya, no run the batsman rehearses his arms-shouldering this time as the ball slinks through on a good length just down the channel
Bracken to Jayasuriya, 1 run outside off and Jayasuirya latches on to today's coup de choix with a blow up and out to third man
Lee to Jayasuriya, (no ball) an overstepped no-ball now
Lee to Jayasuriya, 1 wide he wanders across his stumps and Lee aims at leg stump, goes wide and gets called for it
Lee to Jayasuriya, no run the slower ball pays off, the batsman pushing out on the front foot and the ball skews to Haddin at midwicket
Lee to Jayasuriya, 1 run waits on the back foot and pushes out to the covers this time
Lee to Sangakkara, 1 run outside off, waits on the back foot and plays down to wide third man
Lee to Jayasuriya, 1 run right up there on the legs, driven out to mid-on and the batsmen run through
Lee to Sangakkara, no run a good leave down off on a good length, the batsman shouldering arms
Lee to Sangakkara, no run tight delivery, up there in line with off, defended on the front foot
Bracken to Jayasuriya, no run outside off, the batsman moves into the line of the ball and defends off the back foot
Bracken to Jayasuriya, OUT the ball climbs on him outside off and Jayasuriya prods an outside edge through on the front foot, Hussey takes the catch at first slip
Bracken to Mahela Jayawardene, no run fires this across the right hander, on a good length, who defends on the front foot
Bracken to Mahela Jayawardene, no run pushed through outside off
Bracken to Mahela Jayawardene, no run lets this one go through outside off once more
Bracken to Mahela Jayawardene, no run completes a wicket maiden in style, the ball going through just outside off, and left alone
Johnson to Sangakkara, FOUR runs turned round the corner through fine leg and that one goes all the way, a fine clip
Johnson to Sangakkara, no run comes out and defends on the front foot this time
Johnson to Sangakkara, no run defended on the front foot in line with off now
Johnson to Sangakkara, no run forces the forward defensive once more
Johnson to Sangakkara, no run outside off, defended back into the ground
Johnson to Sangakkara, FOUR runs outside off, Sangakkara leans into a cover-drive that tracers away as if on a marble surface
Bracken to Mahela Jayawardene, no run Bracken hits a good length again, the batsman defending on the front foot in line with off

Bracken to Mahela Jayawardene, 1 run pushes across the right hander Jayawardene who drives into the covers and the pair set off, Hopes throws back in and a direct shy would have had him out by more than a metre
Bracken to Sangakkara, no run waits on the back foot in line with off, and pushes into the covers
Bracken to Sangakkara, no run wiats outside off and defended on the front foot into the covers
Bracken to Sangakkara, no run a good length in line with off, pushed down into the leg side
Bracken to Sangakkara, 1 run on middle and off, tucked down from hip-height off the back foot and in front of square, an easy single for them
Johnson to Sangakkara, no run pushed up there on off, and defended in front of him
Johnson to Sangakkara, no run on line with off, defended on the front foot

Johnson to Sangakkara, OUT boomed in from over the wicket in line with off, Sangakkara's head and bat go one way, the ball the other, hard through to Hussey who takes another catch at first slip, this one clinging on well with two hands
Johnson to Kapugedera, no run across the right hander who defends on the front foot
Johnson to Kapugedera, no run left alone this time
Johnson to Kapugedera, 1 run driven forward this time to round off yet another good over
Bracken to Kapugedera, no run stays over the wicket, fires across him on a good length and it's left alone
Bracken to Kapugedera, no run defended on the back foot into point
Bracken to Kapugedera, no run rolled up in front of off, full up there, and defended into the covers

Bracken to Kapugedera, no run outside off, pushed into midwicket and comes down for what he thought was an easy single, Jayawardene says no and is then nearly run out as he was dawdling outside his crease, Bracken's shy, if he had connected, would have had him as we
Bracken to Kapugedera, no run defended on the front foot outside off
Bracken to Kapugedera, no run jags the ball across the right hander, who tucks the bat behind his pad very quickly indeed, not at all interested as it licks down off
Johnson to Mahela Jayawardene, no run defended on the front foot in line with off this time
Johnson to Mahela Jayawardene, no run outside off and defended on the back foot into the covers

Johnson to Mahela Jayawardene, no run finds some extra bounce in the track there, generated from his action as he shoulders the boulder into the deck, short, and nearly takes Jayawardene's thumb as he defends down off the back foot
Johnson to Mahela Jayawardene, 2 runs pushed into the covers on the front foot this time
Johnson to Mahela Jayawardene, no run defended on the front foot
Johnson to Mahela Jayawardene, 1 run a quick push forward
Bracken to Mahela Jayawardene, no run waits on the back foot to defend
Bracken to Mahela Jayawardene, 1 run a single guided down to third man
Bracken to Kapugedera, no run down off, left alone
Bracken to Kapugedera, no run ripped down off again, that nagging angle meaning the batsman is quick to leave it
Bracken to Kapugedera, no run outside off, pushed into the covers
Bracken to Kapugedera, no run a slower ball to finish, dropped in on off, the batsman not tempted to tangle with the dangle

Johnson to Mahela Jayawardene, 1 run tucked down on the back foot in front of off, the batsmen chase through cheekily, Johnson shies to the non-striker's to end their fun but doesn't pick up a coconut
Johnson to Kapugedera, 1 run driven out square to point and they scramble through quickly again
Johnson to Mahela Jayawardene, no run outside off, lets that one go through
Johnson to Mahela Jayawardene, FOUR runs driven out through the covers, a superb stroke from Jayawardene, peeled off the bat and that travelled to bring up the fifty
Johnson to Mahela Jayawardene, no run outside off, shortish, defended down on the back foot
Johnson to Mahela Jayawardene, 1 run pushed across him outside off, driven back into Hogg who's one of a number in an off-side half-moon, tries to hit, misses, laughs
Hopes to Mahela Jayawardene, FOUR runs outside off and laces a cover drive that rockets out to the rope
Hopes to Mahela Jayawardene, no run outside off, defended down off the back foot into the covers
Hopes to Mahela Jayawardene, 1 run waits and defends on the front foot, the batsmen shuttle through
Hopes to Kapugedera, no run pushed through on a good length down off, left alone outside off, shouldering arms and the like
Hopes to Kapugedera, no run nips back in a touch from outside off, the batsman tries to reel off a back-foot cover drive, and picks out the fielder instead
Hopes to Kapugedera, no run outside off, defended into the ground

Johnson to Mahela Jayawardene, 1 run good running from the pair who rush through after the ball's popped down diagonally away from him, only a metre or so, Johnson follows through and picks up the ball, attempting the underarm, misses
Johnson to Kapugedera, no run a hint of away swing as the ball curls away down off
Johnson to Kapugedera, no run pitches outside off, a good-length delivery sleeking through and there's another leave
Johnson to Kapugedera, no run good pace and carry again down off
Johnson to Kapugedera, no run outside off, thumped off the front foot to Symonds in the covers, who dives and cuts it off somehow
Johnson to Kapugedera, no run the ball goes across him and he defends down on the back foot behind him
Hopes to Mahela Jayawardene, no run width outside off, Jayawardene cuts hard off the back foot to point
Hopes to Mahela Jayawardene, no run a tidy ball on off, defended with a clamp. Well, with a bat
Hopes to Mahela Jayawardene, no run outside off, cut down off the back foot to the gully

Hopes to Mahela Jayawardene, 1 run comes in to him again outside off, a fair length turned down off the back foot to Lee at deep third man who fields, then has to stop his own hat... from flying off with the wind. It's a wide-brimmed number by the way
Hopes to Kapugedera, OUT moved off the pitch, left him a touch, and Kapugedera leaves his bat dangling away from his body, the ball travelling on through to Gilchrist who takes it without alarm
Hopes to Dilshan, no run played down off the back foot into the covers
Johnson to Mahela Jayawardene, FOUR runs wide outside off, cut down hard, and with good control, to point
Johnson to Mahela Jayawardene, no run short ball outside off, left alone through to the keeper
Johnson to Mahela Jayawardene, no run outside off, cut out to point
Johnson to Mahela Jayawardene, no run short ball outside off, defended back down without too much fuss
Johnson to Mahela Jayawardene, 1 run on middle, turned out behind square
Johnson to Dilshan, (no ball) 1 run down leg, turned down to fine leg, and there's now a free hit
Johnson to Mahela Jayawardene, 1 wide boomed down leg, a bouncer, and it's wide on height, so another free hit results

Johnson to Mahela Jayawardene, FOUR runs on middle, and doesn't miss out, Jayawardene gives himself enough room to drive high and hard over long-off, the ball just plugging inside the rope and jumps over the rope
Hogg to Dilshan, 1 run on leg, pulled round behind square
Hogg to Mahela Jayawardene, no run outside off, bent back towards the batsman
Hogg to Mahela Jayawardene, 2 runs outside off, swept round behind square and it's zoomed back in

Hogg to Mahela Jayawardene, 3 runs outside off,chopped down to third man where Clarke chases and Jayawardene could have been run out as Gilchrist took the return and then tried to hit the stumps at the non-striker's end. Jayawardene, who's riding his run-out lives t
Hogg to Dilshan, no run pitches outside off and moves away wider
Hogg to Dilshan, 1 run turned down outside off, to third man
Johnson to Dilshan, 1 wide wide down off
Johnson to Dilshan, no run outside off, short, and (de)fended into short midwicket
Johnson to Dilshan, 2 runs turned off the legs to midwicket and they get back comfortably
Johnson to Dilshan, 3 runs outside off, pierces the gap in the ring, but the sound of the bat hinted that it wasn't cleanly connected
Johnson to Mahela Jayawardene, no run outside off and left alone
Johnson to Mahela Jayawardene, no run worked to short midwicket off the back foot
Johnson to Mahela Jayawardene, no run outside off, pushed down the channel on a good length, and left alone
Hogg to Dilshan, no run ooh, nearly chops back on from middle, the ball a bit too tight for doing that
Hogg to Dilshan, no run turned back in to him, worked out to the legs
Hogg to Dilshan, no run outside off, played down off the back foot to point
Hogg to Dilshan, no run down leg, turned to short fine leg
Hogg to Dilshan, no run comes on the front foot and defends into the covers
Hogg to Dilshan, no run on middle and leg, turned to short midwicket
Hopes to Mahela Jayawardene, 1 run outside off, popped up off the back foot towards the covers, but in no danger.. for now
Hopes to Dilshan, no run outside off, nearly chops back on with a drive into the ground
Hopes to Dilshan, no run good length ball, up there on off, pushed into the covers
Hopes to Dilshan, 2 runs outside off, cut down through backward point
Hopes to Dilshan, no run fired right up there in line with off, pushed out in a defensive manner
Hopes to Dilshan, 2 runs outside off, cut down off the back foot behind point and they get back for a comfortable two, Hogg doing the fielding
Hogg to Mahela Jayawardene, no run loop outside off, Jayawardene shuffles over, then leaves
Hogg to Mahela Jayawardene, 1 run picked off the legs and swivelled round behind square
Hogg to Dilshan, 1 run on middle, pulled round this time
Hogg to Mahela Jayawardene, 1 run looped up, driven out to the covers and there's a direct shy from Hogg but Jayawardene was just back in
Hogg to Dilshan, 1 run turns back in from just outside off, and brushed out to short midwicket
Hopes to Dilshan, no run clips in just outside off, the batsman eases out to point off the front foot
Hopes to Dilshan, 1 run veering down leg, helpd round the corner and on to fine
Hopes to Mahela Jayawardene, 1 run outside off, cut down off the back foot to third man
Hopes to Dilshan, 1 run nipped back in from outside off, defended on the front foot into the covers
Hopes to Mahela Jayawardene, no run nipped in again from outside off, defended on the front foot with no fuss
Hopes to Mahela Jayawardene, 1 run plugs the off-side channel again, turned down to third man

Hogg to Mahela Jayawardene, 1 leg bye good loop on middle and leg, turned down to short fine leg and has to hurry through to the non-striker's, although Symonds' throw was just wide and even if it wasn't he probably would have been back
Hogg to Dilshan, 3 runs driven out to the covers and there's an overthrow, too
Hogg to Mahela Jayawardene, no run turned back in from off to in line with leg, defended down on the back foot
Hogg to Mahela Jayawardene, no run on middle and leg, turned to short midwicket, rather tried to, the ball crashing down in front of him
Hogg to Mahela Jayawardene, no run driven out to mid-on
Hogg to Mahela Jayawardene, no run on middle, good loop and length, eased out to mid-on
Clarke to Dilshan, no run looped in a full toss, pushed out to the covers, cramped for room a touch
Clarke to Dilshan, 1 wide down leg, the batsman follows it round
Clarke to Dilshan, 1 run on leg this time, pushed off down to short fine leg
Clarke to Mahela Jayawardene, FOUR runs down leg, pulled round through fine leg
Clarke to Mahela Jayawardene, 4 wide down leg, gone through very fine indeed and Hussey does well to chase it down and then throws down the stumps at the striker's end, but the batsman was in
Clarke to Dilshan, 1 run on leg, turned to midwicket
Clarke to Mahela Jayawardene, no run driven out straight
Clarke to Mahela Jayawardene, 1 run turned off the legs to Hussey at backward square
Hogg to Mahela Jayawardene, 2 runs on off, bends in a touch to middle, and turned out to midwicket
Hogg to Mahela Jayawardene, no run more of the same, defended off the back foot into short square
Hogg to Mahela Jayawardene, no run on middle, turned out off the front foot to a short point
Hogg to Mahela Jayawardene, no run up there on off, defended on the front foot
Hogg to Mahela Jayawardene, no run on middle and leg, squeezed down to short fine leg
Hogg to Mahela Jayawardene, 1 run full delivery on off, chipped away well to midwicket
Clarke to Mahela Jayawardene, no run full delivery on off, driven back out to the bowler
Clarke to Mahela Jayawardene, 2 runs low full toss, driven out to the covers
Clarke to Mahela Jayawardene, 1 run right up there on middle, turned to short fine leg, who wings it back in but the batsman is safe
Clarke to Dilshan, 1 run tucked off the legs just behind square
Clarke to Mahela Jayawardene, 1 run on the legs, turned out behind square
Clarke to Dilshan, no run turned back in, pushed off the back foot to the covers
Hogg to Mahela Jayawardene, 1 run squeezed out to point off the front foot to bring up a well-worked fifty from 65 balls
Hogg to Dilshan, no run pushed back out to the bowler
Hogg to Dilshan, no run dragged it short, pulled hard to the man at short midwicket
Hogg to Dilshan, no run turned back in from outside off, defended back down with no fuss
Hogg to Dilshan, 1 run outside leg, turned behind square for an easy single
Hogg to Mahela Jayawardene, OUT a huge and sustained appeal as the umpire deliberates before giving him out, trapped on the front foot by the flipper, moving back in to middle and off
Lee to Dilshan, no run the batsman is quick to duck out of a searing bouncer that scorches past the helmet in line with off
Lee to Dilshan, 1 run down leg, turned down to deep fine leg
Lee to Silva, no run up there on off, defended on the front foot
Lee to Silva, 1 run turned down behind square from in line with off
Lee to Dilshan, no run full delivery, driven out to mid-on
Lee to Dilshan, no run banged in short down the channel, the batsman sways away
Hogg to Silva, no run on middle, spinning into the pads
Hogg to Silva, no run squares him up on off and he enters into a Chanderpaul-trademarked crab-like defence
Hogg to Silva, 1 run driven forward this time
Hogg to Dilshan, 1 run played off the legs to square
Hogg to Silva, FOUR runs loop outside off and driven hard through the covers, pleasing the Sri Lankan contingent
Lee to Dilshan, 1 run tight ball on off, but driven out to mid-on for a quick single
Lee to Silva, no run outside off, driven to the man at cover
Lee to Silva, 1 run outside off, driven through the covers
Lee to Dilshan, 2 runs on off, turned out in front of midwicket
Lee to Dilshan, FOUR runs a short ball now, pulled in front of square for four solid runs, well played
Lee to Dilshan, no run outside off, let it go through past him on a good length
Hogg to Silva, no run comes down the track to meet a shortish one on middle, boomed round a pull to fine leg, the ball bouncing way in front of him
Hogg to Silva, 1 run extra loop on middle, driven forward this time
Hogg to Dilshan, no run turned back in from outside off, and guided out down to third man
Hogg to Dilshan, 1 run on middle, pulled round to fine leg
Hogg to Silva, no run outside off, deceived him there, but the batsman dips down his bat just in time
Hogg to Silva, no run on off, the batsman turns it to square
Lee to Dilshan, 2 runs a low full toss, driven out through straight mid-on and again the batsmen chance their running and get away with it
Lee to Dilshan, 1 run outside off, cut down to third man
Lee to Silva, 1 run outside off, cut down off the back foot behind gully
Lee to Dilshan, no run cut down to gully off the back foot
Lee to Dilshan, 2 runs some wobble in the air, and cut down off the back foot to third man
Lee to Dilshan, 1 run short ball, didn't get hold of it as it was on to him faster than expected, the ball pops up to fine leg
Hogg to Dilshan, 1 run turned away from outside off, and pulled over to square
Hogg to Silva, 1 run outside leg, tucked down to square
Hogg to Dilshan, 1 run looped up in line with off, driven out to long-off
Hogg to Silva, no run turned away past the batsman outside off, left alone
Hogg to Silva, no run turned back in outside off, defended down to gully off the back foot
Hogg to Silva, no run turned past the outside edge, the batsman comes forward to defend
Hopes to Dilshan, no run outside off, pulled back towards mid-on
Hopes to Dilshan, 1 run outside off, cut into point, there's a shy and another miss
Hopes to Silva, 1 run turned to short midwicket and they hammer through
Hopes to Dilshan, 1 run pulled away behind square this time
Hopes to Silva, 1 run outside off, pushed down to the gully off the back foot
Hopes to Dilshan, 1 run on middle and leg, inside-edged safely into short midwicket
Hogg to Dilshan, 1 run turned on off back into middle, and pulled round to fine leg
Hogg to Silva, no run on the legs, turned down to short fine leg this time
Hogg to Silva, no run on the legs, defended back down in front of him
Hogg to Silva, 1 run on middle and leg, knocked down in front of square, just a push off the legs
Hogg to Dilshan, no run big loop, attempted sweep from a straight delivery, gets some bat on it
Hogg to Dilshan, 1 run on middle, driven out to mid-off for a single and the end of a good spell for Hogg for his last ball on this ground
Hopes to Dilshan, FOUR runs outside off, waits and pulls hard up and over forward square leg, all his msucle behind that one to bring up an excellent fifty from 61 balls with two fours
Hopes to Dilshan, 1 run pulled off the legs to square now
Hopes to Silva, 2 runs pushed out on the legs again
Hopes to Silva, no run good line and length and beat him, past his outside edge as he pushed forward to defend outside off
Hopes to Silva, 1 run outside off again, cut to point and Clarke tidies up
Hopes to Dilshan, no run short ball, a good bouncer at 131kph, the batsman shapes to pull and is trhough with the shot
Johnson to Silva, no run outside off, pushed down to gully, Dilshan sets off and is sent back, scrambles into his crease as the throw comes in
Johnson to Silva, no run drives hard at it outside off but doesn't make contact
Johnson to Silva, no run pushed across him from over the wicket, the batsman leaves it this time
Johnson to Silva, no run squares up behind it on off, pushed out to point off the back foot
Johnson to Silva, no run on off, strides out and drives to mid-on
Johnson to Silva, no run outside off, the batsman cuts hard at it, but the ball splays wider
Hopes to Dilshan, 1 run comes out and pulls hard through to long-on
Hopes to Silva, no run outside off, defended back to the bowler
Hopes to Silva, no run bouncer on middle, goes to hook it, the ball goes on over the helmet
Hopes to Silva, 1 run on middle and leg, turned through the 45 off the hips
Hopes to Dilshan, 1 run outside off, cut hard to backward point now
Hopes to Silva, no run outside off, cut down off the back foot to third man
Johnson to Dilshan, (no ball) 2 runs full toss outside off, goes for the firm pull and Hogg can't quite get around to it at long-off
Johnson to Dilshan, 1 run driven out to mid-off and Bracken tidies up
Johnson to Silva, 1 run outside off, driven out to deep extra cover
Johnson to Dilshan, FOUR runs outside off, short ball, and pulled hard straight behind him for four, that raced to the rope off the top edge
Johnson to Dilshan, 1 run outside off, cut down to third man
Johnson to Silva, 2 runs outside off, driven hard up and just over the top of the fielder at backward point, Clarke
Johnson to Silva, no run that's past him, too good, outside off and the batsman stabs down defensively
Hopes to Dilshan, 1 run goes for the yorker on leg, but that's a low full toss and driven out to straight long-on
Hopes to Silva, OUT on off, pushed forward and Hopes does well to run up and underarm on to the stumps, Dilshan goes
Hopes to Kulasekara, no run short ball outside off, the batsman sways out of the way of it
Hopes to Kulasekara, no run outside off, pulled forward to mid-on for a quick single
Hopes to Kulasekara, no run outside off, cut back in, pushed out off the back foot to short cover
Hopes to Kulasekara, no run short ball to finish the over, hopped away from
Johnson to Silva, no run slower ball, guided out off the back foot to third man
Johnson to Silva, 1 run attempted the yorker, pushed it a touch too wide, and it's cut away behind point
Johnson to Kulasekara, 1 run yorker on off, driven out to straight long-off
Johnson to Silva, 1 run pushed down off
Johnson to Kulasekara, no run pushed again outside off
Johnson to Kulasekara, 1 run played down off the back foot to mid-on for another quick single
Lee to Kulasekara, no run fired down off, the batsman leaves it alone on a good length
Lee to Kulasekara, no run defended forward
Lee to Kulasekara, 1 run driven out to mid-off for a quick single
Lee to Silva, 1 run outside off and driven to the covers this time
Lee to Kulasekara, no run spears this one in just outside off, full again, and the batsman waits before working it down to third man
Lee to Kulasekara, (no ball) 1 run another overstep, so another free hit coming up, driven out to the covers meanwhile
Lee to Silva, FOUR runs the slower ball, but Lee doesn't profit as he did last time around, instead Silva pulls it round hard behind square
Bracken to Kulasekara, 1 run round the wicket, pitches it up there outside off and it's driven out to deep extra cover
Bracken to Silva, FOUR runs on middle and off, swept round and Gilchrist puts in a half-shout, thinking that maybe it hit pad
Bracken to Silva, FOUR runs outside off, pulled hard behind square for a well-struck four
Bracken to Silva, OUT over the wicket now, the batsman comes down the ground and drives up hard and high out to Johnson at long-on who holds on just below his neck
Bracken to Kulasekara, no run good yorker, dug out back towards Bracken who tidies up off his own bowling
Bracken to Kulasekara, 1 run low full toss, driven out to long-on this time
Lee to Kulasekara, 1 run driven forward

Lee to Malinga, OUT short ball, which is pulled high and higher over towards Hopes who has to come in a fair few metres, the batsman not getting over it and he goes for a golden duck in the interests of trying to boost the score
Lee to Kulasekara, no run short one goes over the head, the batsman ducks
Lee to Kulasekara, 1 run into the legs, driven without much power to mid-on
Lee to Murali, 1 run right up there on off, driven back out to mid-off
Lee to Kulasekara, 1 run pushed right up there and defended down behind point
Bracken to Kulasekara, 1 run on middle, and just not quite timed, the ball driven up to mid-on, just in front of Johnson
Bracken to Murali, OUT comprehensively yorked, Muralitharan backing away to try to club-cut to the covers and exposing his stumps which are subsequently shattered as he chops back on
Bracken to MKDI Amerasinghe, FOUR runs outside off, drives hard, and an inside edge runs through the vacant third man area
Bracken to MKDI Amerasinghe, 1 run a leading edge up to Symonds in the covers who fluffs the run-out chance at the non-striker's with the underarm
Bracken to Kulasekara, FOUR runs a half-volley and he laces it through the covers, the ball runs on all the way to the rope

Bracken to Kulasekara, OUT slower ball aimed on off, the batsman goes to pull, is through the shot too quickly and leaves the hugest gap for the ball to go on and crahs into the top of off, leaving Bracken with four wickets

Sri Lanka's batsmen did well to come back from 4 earlyish wickets to post 221, with good fifties from Jayawardene and Dilshan. The good news for Australia is that their batsmen will get to practice chasing now, they've got something of a target to try to hunt down. Join us
Right, we're ready for the chase. The Sri Lankans line-up on either side to give Gilchrist a farewell
Malinga to Gilchrist, no run Malinga bangs it in short of a length outside off, Gilchrist rocks back and chops it down the pitch
Malinga to Gilchrist, no run hits a good length and pitches it on off, Gilchrist gets covers the line and pushes back to the bowler
Malinga to Gilchrist, no run opens the face of the bat and slices it down to the covers, Gilchrist turns down the single

Malinga to Gilchrist, FOUR runs Gilly's underway.... Malinga grants him just a little width outside off Gilchrist stands tall and slices it swiftly in the arc between cover and extra cover, superb timing there
Malinga to Gilchrist, no run pitches outside off, Gilchrist chops it down hard to point
Malinga to Gilchrist, no run fullish outside the off stump, he gets across and chips it uppishly towards mid-off
Kulasekara to Hopes, no run slides on the pads and lands on a full length, he turns the face of the bat and works it to midwicket

Kulasekara to Hopes, no run big appeal... hits a good length outside off and curves in a little, Hopes goes on the backfoot and meets the ball very close to the pads in line with the stumps, Kulasekara appeals but the umpire reckoned there was bat on it. That was a r
Kulasekara to Hopes, 1 run gets a touch forward and works it just wide of mid-on
Kulasekara to Gilchrist, 1 run pitches outside off, he taps it just wide of cover for a single
Kulasekara to Hopes, 3 runs strays on the pads, Hopes gets a long way across and works it wide of square leg and places it really square on the on side, allowing three comfortable runs
Kulasekara to Gilchrist, no run a little too full outside off and luckily for the bowler Gilchrist only places it straight to mid-off
Malinga to Hopes, 1 run gets a good stride forward, plays a forward defensive push just wide of mid-off, good running
Malinga to Gilchrist, 1 run fired in close to a yorker length, Gilchrist plays an inside out stroke, tries to work it to the on side but meets the ball off the slice and plays it third man instead
Malinga to Hopes, no run hits a good length on off stump, he gets a good stride forward and defends
Malinga to Hopes, 1 wide bangs it in really short and that sails over Hopes' hunched back, wide called
Malinga to Hopes, 2 runs hits a good length on middle, he gets across quickly and tucks it wide of square leg, the timing is good
Malinga to Hopes, no run better line, pitches outside off and draws Hopes forward, he defends solidly

Malinga to Hopes, FOUR runs brilliant placement and timing, hits a good length outside off and hust shapes away, Hopes gets forward, offers the full face and pushes it off the meat of the bat just wide of mid-off, the ball races away
Kulasekara to Gilchrist, no run gets forward just a touch and pushes to mid-off
Kulasekara to Gilchrist, no run fuller in length, he drives straight along the pitch and Kulasekara does well to throw himself to his right and intercept that with one hand
Kulasekara to Gilchrist, no run pushes it in front of mid-off, he contemplates a single but decides against it
Kulasekara to Gilchrist, no run gets across his stumps on the backfoot and taps it to point with an angled bat
Kulasekara to Gilchrist, no run fired in fuller outside off, he chops it down hard on the pitch and just beats short cover, mid-off stops it
Kulasekara to Gilchrist, no run maiden over, he tucks it away quietly straight to midwicket
MKDI Amerasinghe to Hopes, no run pitches it just short of a length outside off, Hopes offers the full face of the bat and pushes to mid-on
MKDI Amerasinghe to Hopes, no run gets forward and drives hard straight to short cover
MKDI Amerasinghe to Hopes, 2 runs banged in short outside off, Hopes goes for the pull and manages to clear midwicket but the timing isn't how he would have liked
MKDI Amerasinghe to Hopes, no run gets across and punches it straight to point this time
MKDI Amerasinghe to Hopes, no run tucks him up a bit outside the offstump, he still covers the line well and pushes to the offside
MKDI Amerasinghe to Hopes, no run pitches outside off, he gets across and slices it to the region of cover
Kulasekara to Gilchrist, 2 runs short of a length on middle, Gilchrist pulls and clears square leg, luckily he checks his stroke as deep backward square-leg could have swallowed it
Kulasekara to Gilchrist, 1 run pushes it with soft hands just in front of mid-off and sets off quickly
Kulasekara to Hopes, no run full in length and slanting in, he once again covers the line with the full face of the bat and defends to the off side
Kulasekara to Hopes, no run gets across his stumps, turns the face of the bat a little and tucks it to mid-on
Kulasekara to Hopes, no run just holds the length back outside off, he gets a stride across and pushes it off the front foot to cover
Kulasekara to Hopes, no run slower ball, he waits on it, stays at the crease and softly taps it to the on side
MKDI Amerasinghe to Gilchrist, FOUR runs pitches it up outside off, that's in the slot for Gilchrist as he scoops it through the line and carts it over mid-off

MKDI Amerasinghe to Gilchrist, 3 runs picks the ball on a fullish length outside off and tees off across the line, the ball is aerial for a long time, bounces a couple of times before the midwicket boundary. No real timing there
MKDI Amerasinghe to Hopes, 1 run fullish on middle, he drives through the line and the bowler gets a finger to it on the dive
MKDI Amerasinghe to Gilchrist, SIX runs timing and distance.... hits a good length on middle, Gilchrist waits on it and reads the length very early as he pulls off the meat of the bat over square leg
MKDI Amerasinghe to Gilchrist, no run drives away from the body and the inside edge nearly rolls onto his stumps

MKDI Amerasinghe to Gilchrist, 4 runs the over gets more expensive as Gilchrist scoops over the off side, the fielder at cover leaps and valiantly tries to pull off a blinder, the ball just stops before the rope
Malinga to Hopes, 1 run goes for an uppish drive, checks his stroke at the last second and nearly lobs it to mid-off, the ball beats the fielder on the dive and they pick up a single
Malinga to Gilchrist, no run well bowled.... fires in a yorker outside off and Gilchrist doesn't pick it at all as the ball creeps past the toe of the bat
Malinga to Gilchrist, no run gets forward and pushes to the off side
Malinga to Gilchrist, no run fired in close to a yorker length on middle, he gets across and works it straight to midwicket
Malinga to Gilchrist, FOUR runs full, just marginally wide outside off, Gilchrist gets forward on his knee, takes the ball on the full and executes a flashy square drive past backward point
Malinga to Gilchrist, FOUR runs attemps another yorker, gets forward, takes the ball on the full and just bisects the gap between mid-off and cover
Murali to Hopes, 1 wide starts down leg with a wide
Murali to Hopes, no run wide of the crease and Hopes rocks back and follows the ball outside off, through teh shot too late
Murali to Hopes, 1 run down on one knee and forces the sweep hard with a firm push through midwicket to bring the ominous Gilchrist back on strike

Murali to Gilchrist, no run oh and Sri Lanka nearly had him fairly early too - Muralitharan trapping in from of middle and off, Gilchrist hadn't read the doosra and there didn't seem to much wrong with it, it kept low, too
Murali to Gilchrist, no run into the legs and Gilchrist brushes at it, a half-shout only this time
Murali to Gilchrist, 3 runs Gilchrist goes over the top now, with a fluorishing drive over long-on, it plugs in the deep and then is chased down
Murali to Hopes, no run comes in a touch from outside off, still outside the line when it's defended on the front foot
Malinga to Gilchrist, 2 runs full ball outside off, pushed out through mid-off and Jayasuriya doesn't cover himself with glory as he lets the ball go through his legs

Malinga to Gilchrist, FOUR runs attempted yorker on middle, just a fraction short which is all Gilchrist needs to drive hard straight past the bowler who can't even start to get down to it by the time it's past him
Malinga to Gilchrist, FOUR runs outside off, and Gilchrist merely frees the arms and the ball flies off the thick edge down into the ground and on its way through third man
Malinga to Gilchrist, no run down leg, tries to swipe it round
Malinga to Gilchrist, FOUR runs outside off and there ideed is the fifty as he cracks the ball off the back foot through point and it rockets to the rope

Malinga to Gilchrist, no run the yorker dug out to Jayawardene at skipper-off as I call the position which is the shortest mid-off you'll ever see, a metre past the bowler's crease and also favoured by Michael Vaughan and Ricky Ponting, though usually in Tests
Murali to Hopes, no run driven out to mid-off, quiet ball
Murali to Hopes, 1 run round the wicket, Hopes works into the gap at short midwicket
Murali to Gilchrist, 2 runs outside leg and Gilchrist goes across to meet it, tickling a leg glance down
Murali to Gilchrist, no run down leg a touch again, Gilchrist brushes it down
Murali to Gilchrist, FOUR runs Gilchrist comes out of his crease now and drives hard through long-off, that one travelled, Murali was across and nearly stopped it with a dive to his left

Murali to Gilchrist, FOUR runs Murali drags it a touch short and Gilchrist is immediately on to it, splaying his legs wide and setting himself to pull it just wide of mid-on. He then takes two paces and stops, knowing it's going to go all the way
Kulasekara to Hopes, no run outside off, driven out to mid-off, quiet stuff
Kulasekara to Hopes, FOUR runs short and wide outside off, cut hard behind point and the ball rolls on its merry way to the rope
Kulasekara to Hopes, no run outside off, just a fraction, Hopes tries to tuck it into leg, but tucks it into his own legs
Kulasekara to Hopes, 1 run a fraction short of a length and Hopes drives out to mid-on and Gilchrist is back on strike
Kulasekara to Gilchrist, FOUR runs straight bouncer and Gilchrist latches on with a swivel-pull of pure timing over midwicket
Kulasekara to Gilchrist, no run full on off, and driven out to long-off, they decide not to take the single
Murali to Hopes, 1 run front-foot defended out to mid-on and Hopes gets Gilchrist back on strike
Murali to Gilchrist, 1 run on leg, swept out to deep square
Murali to Hopes, no run on the legs, swept down to the man at fine leg, Jayasuriya
Murali to Hopes, 1 run pushes to the covers for a quick single and they run through
Murali to Gilchrist, FOUR runs good use of the feet, Gilchrist comes down and drives back over mid-on for a one-bounce four, hit right through the line

Murali to Gilchrist, SIX runs comes out again and drives up and over straight, he doesn't even bother to take one step this time as he knows that's going to go to the boundary. Replays show that it was a six, so it must have hit the rope on the full
Kulasekara to Hopes, no run comes out and pushes back to the bowler
Kulasekara to Hopes, no run a huge shout for one which cuts back in outside off and would have gone on to hit off stump, but it matters not because it was bat first
Kulasekara to Hopes, no run outside off, pushed to short midwicket
Kulasekara to Hopes, no run on off and middle, pulled round in front of square, done for pace and it comes off the gloves, Hopes wasn't really sure where it had gone
Kulasekara to Hopes, no run stands tall, and defends on the back foot back towards the bowler
Kulasekara to Hopes, FOUR runs now it's Hopes's turn to shine, standing there and waiting to launch into a flowing drive which goes up and over the bowler and loops down just before the rope
Murali to Gilchrist, 1 run placed into short midwicket for a quiet single
Murali to Hopes, no run on off, turned round the corner to leg gully
Murali to Hopes, no run reaches just outside off to sweep to midwicket

Murali to Hopes, OUT ah, what's gone on here, the ball past him and nudges the off stump and the bail comes off, it takes a while to realise he's actually bowled, as it could also have been a stumping by Sangakkara and Hopes had moved in front of the stumps so you c
Murali to Ponting, no run turned back in from outside off, defended on the back foot
Murali to Ponting, no run comes right out, looking to attack, but ends up defending on the front foot
Kulasekara to Gilchrist, 2 runs short outside off Gilchrist cuts hard off the back foot behind point
Kulasekara to Gilchrist, 2 runs full delivery outside off, driven out to extra cover and they come back well for two
Kulasekara to Gilchrist, 2 runs outside off and pulled up safe out to long-on and they come back for two, the ball coming up off the base of the bat

Kulasekara to Gilchrist, OUT fabulous catch by Malinga! Gilchrist goes for the aerial drive once more, booming the ball up to long-off where Malinga charges round and takes the ball in front of him on the slide, great catch to end a great innings
Kulasekara to Ponting, no run right up there on off, defended on the front foot
MKDI Amerasinghe to Clarke, no run cut back in from outside off on a good length, the batsman drives into his legs
MKDI Amerasinghe to Clarke, no run on off, climbing from a good length, the batsman defends into the covers
MKDI Amerasinghe to Clarke, no run outside off, driven back to the bowler
MKDI Amerasinghe to Clarke, no run outside off, driven off the back foot to the covers
MKDI Amerasinghe to Clarke, no run on to the legs and tucked out behind square
MKDI Amerasinghe to Clarke, no run on off and middle, tight again, driven back out straight
Kulasekara to Ponting, no run defended on the front foot
Kulasekara to Ponting, 1 leg bye pushed on to the legs, and turned back out to fine leg
Kulasekara to Clarke, no run pushed up there on the front foot again, defended forward
Kulasekara to Clarke, no run cut in from outside off, defended once more
Kulasekara to Clarke, no run slower ball, outside off deceives the batsman who drives out just short of the man at cover
Kulasekara to Clarke, no run full toss dips on to the pads, the batsman drives back forward to bring up successive maidens for the bowlers
MKDI Amerasinghe to Ponting, no run defended forward
MKDI Amerasinghe to Ponting, 1 run short ball on off, flicked hard off the legs to fine leg
MKDI Amerasinghe to Symonds, no run nipped back in from outside off, tucked into short midwicket
MKDI Amerasinghe to Symonds, no run defended this time
MKDI Amerasinghe to Symonds, no run and more defence to round off another good over in an encouraging period for Sri Lanka
Kulasekara to Ponting, no run forced on to the front foot to defend
Kulasekara to Ponting, no run and more defence, Australia taking their time to regroup
Kulasekara to Hussey, no run right up there in line with middle, defended on the front foot
Kulasekara to Hussey, no run pushed outside off, left alone on its way through
Kulasekara to Hussey, no run good length outside off and the ball skids through to round off a wicket maiden off
MKDI Amerasinghe to Haddin, no run good swing back in to the right hander who presses forward on a good length
MKDI Amerasinghe to Haddin, no run right up there in line with middle, defended on the front foot

MKDI Amerasinghe to Haddin, no run outside off and again Amerasinghe is up with arms, appealing loudly but although the ball cut back in from outside off there was a huge, huger, hugest inside edge back on to the pads
MKDI Amerasinghe to Haddin, no run on the legs, turned out to short midwicket
MKDI Amerasinghe to Haddin, no run a hint of swing again, width outside off and cut out to point to round out yet another wicket maiden
Malinga to Hussey, no run that was as close as you can get to a wicket without taking one, the ball pitching just outside off and nearly taking the outside edge as it pitches on off and licks through
Malinga to Hussey, no run up there on off and defended on the front foot
Malinga to Hussey, no run outside off, lets it go through

Malinga to Hussey, no run another good delivery, similar to the opening ball of this over and Malinga's broad smile tells you how much he liked that, the ball hitting the seam and moving out past the outside edge
Malinga to Hussey, no run the batsman shoulders arms as the ball goes through

Malinga to Hussey, no run a mix-up, oh dear, Sri Lanka should have had a wicket there as the batsmen get their calling wrong and set off, then have to get back, Haddin is way out but the fielder makes a hash of it and the throw is then wide
MKDI Amerasinghe to Haddin, no run comes back in from outside off, defended on the front foot
MKDI Amerasinghe to Haddin, no run swung in on to the legs, and clipped out to short midwicket
MKDI Amerasinghe to Haddin, 2 runs outside off, overpitched, and Haddin drives out to deep midwicket
MKDI Amerasinghe to Haddin, 2 runs turned off the legs to fine leg and there's some good running between the wickets
MKDI Amerasinghe to Haddin, 1 wide swing down leg and that's given wide, correctly
MKDI Amerasinghe to Haddin, no run outside off, defended down on the back foot
MKDI Amerasinghe to Haddin, 3 runs ...and there's another one, driven out over mid-on
Malinga to Haddin, no run outside off, full delivery, pushed into the ground back towards the cover

Malinga to Haddin, OUT cracking yorker right up there on middle and the umpire needed only a fraction of a second to put up the finger. Haddin was completely beaten with the change of pace there, stabbing down on the ball
Malinga to Hogg, no run stabbed into the ground outside off, there was not much more he could have done with that one
Malinga to Hogg, 2 runs full delivery on off, driven out to the deep cover region where it's well chased by Dilshan
Malinga to Hogg, no run on off, stabbed down into the gully region this time
Malinga to Hogg, 1 run yorker on off and an overthrow from some enthusiastic fielding
Murali to Hogg, no run good loop on off, the batsman waits and patiently pushes back into the ground
Murali to Hogg, 3 runs pitches on middle, works out across him and he guides it down to third man
Murali to Hussey, no run on leg, moves across to off on a good length and Hussey gets over it to defend
Murali to Hussey, no run defended on the front foot
Murali to Hussey, 1 run overpitched on off, Hussey drives out to mid-off and is off the mark after 12 balls
Murali to Hogg, 1 run overpitched on off again, this time it's driven out to mid-on
Malinga to Hogg, no run wide outside off, cut out to point
Malinga to Hogg, 1 run a would-be yorker clipped well off the pads behind square
Malinga to Hussey, no run outside off, a hint of swing, Hussey drives straight to Dilshan at cover
Malinga to Hussey, no run a full delivery just outside off, Hussey gets right over the ball to the covers
Malinga to Hussey, no run full delivery, driven back to the bowler who parries it to Kulasekera at mid-on
Malinga to Hussey, no run outside off and the ball kept low as Hussey drove at it outside off
Murali to Hogg, 1 run up there outside off, pushed forward and they shuffle through
Murali to Hussey, no run width outside leg, Hussey chases it down leg
Murali to Hussey, 1 run outside off, driven out with ease to long-off
Murali to Hogg, no run starts outside leg, just to say turns back in to leg and it's whipped down off the hips to short midwicket
Murali to Hogg, no run fired across him this time and nearly catches the edge as Hogg shapes to cut off the back foot
Murali to Hogg, no run outside off and cut down to gully
Kapugedera to Hussey, no run defended on the front foot
Kapugedera to Hussey, 1 run pushed off the front foot to short midwicket this time
Kapugedera to Hogg, no run nipped back in from outside off, defended back down off the back foot
Kapugedera to Hogg, 1 run wide outside off, the batsman has to stretch out to cut it down to point
Kapugedera to Hussey, 1 run right up there on off, driven out straight and there's a fumble by Silva at straight mid-on who didn't pick it up cleanly - if he had there was every chance of a run-out
Kapugedera to Hogg, 1 run nipped back in outside off and cut down to third man for an easy single
Perera to Hogg, 1 run too short outside off, not to mention wide, and cut down in front of point
Perera to Hussey, no run fired down outside off, left alone
Perera to Hussey, 1 run spins it right in on the toes, and it's clipped in front of square
Perera to Hogg, no run stands firm on the front foot and defends down
Perera to Hogg, 1 run turned out square for a quick single
Perera to Hussey, no run turned off the legs to leg gully and they wisely decide not to run
Kapugedera to Hogg, no run pushed right up there on off and defended forward
Kapugedera to Hogg, 1 run room outside off to cut down to third man
Kapugedera to Lee, no run outside off, cuts back in at the batsman who pushes it out to gully on the back foot
Kapugedera to Lee, no run defends very firmly on the front foot, the head deliberately low
Kapugedera to Lee, 2 runs on middle and off, pushed off the legs to short midwicket and the batsmen scramble desperately
Perera to Hogg, 1 run a quick single, they scramble through
Perera to Lee, no run outside off, pushed back in and defended forward on the front foot, trapping the ball down
Perera to Lee, FOUR runs the first boundary since the 14th over, as Lee drives a firm cover drive through
Perera to Lee, no run a huge shout from bowler and keeper as the ball pitches outside off and came back in to hit somewhere around leg and possibly going over
Perera to Lee, no run defended on the front foot
Perera to Lee, no run the sweep shot and a throaty appeal but the umpire isn't interested, the ball was probably going down there
Kapugedera to Hogg, 1 wide a very wide outside off but Sangakkara takes it well, snapping to his left at knee-height
Kapugedera to Hogg, 1 run driven out square to point
Kapugedera to Lee, no run pushed up there outside off, some movement off the seam, and defended down off the back foot
Kapugedera to Lee, no run driven back to the bowler this time
Kapugedera to Lee, no run outside off, pushed back into the ground and the ball balloons up to the bowler who catches it and some fo the crowd think he's gone
Kapugedera to Lee, no run pushed forward, Lee doesn't really know where it's gone, they think of running through but it's too close for comfort
Kapugedera to Lee, no run outside off, cut down hard off the back foot to gully
Perera to Hogg, no run turned back in on middle, and peeled back out off the back foot to gully
Perera to Hogg, 2 runs dug out off the legs to midwicket
Perera to Hogg, 1 run on the legs, pushed on to the back foot and driven back out to mid-on
Perera to Lee, no run pushed on to the back foot again, and defended back down into the cover region
Perera to Lee, no run stabs down on it, looking to take the ball from outside off to short midwicket, stops on the shot rather
Perera to Lee, no run another sudden stab, Lee coming forward and all he can do is defend, watching the ball on to his bat in front of off
Kapugedera to Hogg, no run turns back in from outside off, and pushed out to point
Kapugedera to Hogg, no run tight ball again, driven back out off the back foot
Kapugedera to Hogg, 1 wide very wide outside off, again Sangakkara does well to snap it up
Kapugedera to Hogg, 1 run curls back in on off and driven out to mid-on
Kapugedera to Lee, no run on off and driven hard back to the bowler
Kapugedera to Lee, 1 run tidy delivery, up there on off, and driven back out to mid-on
Kapugedera to Hogg, 1 run outside off, cut down to deep cover
Murali to Hogg, no run on the legs, some testing bounce as the ball rips past the outside edge, Hogg hiding the bat behind the pad
Murali to Hogg, no run pushed forward into the covers, Murali over the wicket by the way
Murali to Hogg, no run pushed past him again, Hogg has no answer and his grin shows he knows it, too
Murali to Hogg, no run outside off, pushed down to gully, the batsman comes out looking for the single and is sent back
Murali to Johnson, 1 run outside leg, punched out to square off the back foot
Kapugedera to Johnson, no run full delivery, in line with middle and off, driven out to the short cover
Kapugedera to Johnson, no run outside off, the batsman drove back into his pads
Kapugedera to Johnson, 1 run on the legs, clipped in front of midwicket and they charge through
Kapugedera to Lee, no run pushed up there and driven back into the ground towards the bowler
Kapugedera to Lee, no run slower ball, tight up there on off, driven back to him and he picks up the ball well
Kapugedera to Lee, 1 run turned off the legs to midwicket
Murali to Lee, no run round the wicket, pitches on off, Lee practises the stabbing defence once more
Murali to Lee, 1 run comes down the track outside off and drives hard through the covers
Murali to Johnson, no run past the outside edge, not much Johnson could do ans he was beaten outside off as he tried to defend
Murali to Johnson, no run and again, the rip past him too much for Johnson to deal with
Murali to Johnson, no run outside off, defended on the back foot into the pitch

Murali to Johnson, no run the best ball of the lot, again past Johnson's outside edge and Sangakkara was ready for if he fell out of his crease as he looked like he could have done when stumbling forward
Kapugedera to Lee, no run outside off, a firm cut off the back foot, right over the ball
Kapugedera to Lee, no run defends right over it
Kapugedera to Lee, 2 runs full ball on leg, driven out to mid-on
Kapugedera to Lee, no run pushed up there on the front foot
Kapugedera to Lee, SIX runs short ball and hit well over long-on
Kapugedera to Lee, 1 run driven to mid-off
Murali to Lee, 1 run driven out to mid-on
Murali to Johnson, no run defended on the front foot
Murali to Johnson, no run defended on the front foot this time
Murali to Johnson, no run outside leg, pushed down on the front foot, defensively
Murali to Johnson, 1 run played off the legs to midwicket for two
Murali to Lee, no run beaten past the outside edge, Lee forced on to the back foot and defends down the wrong line completely as the ball veers on

MKDI Amerasinghe to Johnson, OUT catch of the night, sends tingles down the spine, and an inspired change too by the same man Jayawardene. Well bowled, drawing him into the drive, and a thick edge skews very wide of Jayawardene at first slip but he leaps out of nowh
MKDI Amerasinghe to Bracken, no run lets that through outside off
MKDI Amerasinghe to Bracken, no run some nasty swing to negotiate, defended on the front foot on a good length
MKDI Amerasinghe to Bracken, no run right up there on off, and defended on the front foot back into the crease
MKDI Amerasinghe to Bracken, 2 runs outside off, cut down off the back foot through gully and they come back for two
MKDI Amerasinghe to Bracken, no run a very firm forward defensive this time in front of off
Malinga to Lee, no run a full delivery on off has Lee hopping into a forward defensive
Malinga to Lee, no run outside off and Lee nearly chopped that back on to leg stump
Malinga to Lee, 1 run full yorker on off, dug out to mid-off this time
Malinga to Bracken, no run very full on off, Malinga loves his yorkers, and Bracken defends into the covers
Malinga to Bracken, 1 run swung up there again, driven out to the covers
Malinga to Lee, 2 runs dug out at the legs and the ball goes out to mid-on
MKDI Amerasinghe to Bracken, 1 run outside off, driven out in front of point
MKDI Amerasinghe to Lee, no run followed him as he backed away to leg and he dug out the ball with an upward push to mid-on
MKDI Amerasinghe to Lee, no run swung in on middle, defended on the front foot into the covers
MKDI Amerasinghe to Lee, 1 run swing again, this one around a line on off, and Lee drives out to mid-off
MKDI Amerasinghe to Bracken, FOUR runs a big defensive and an inside edge crashes away past the leg stump and on its way. It's not over yet

MKDI Amerasinghe to Bracken, 2 leg byes swing down leg, clipped off the pads to fine leg and a wide throw allows the extra run, not quite an overthrow because it didn't really get past the sticks, more it was right in the middle of both sets of stumps
Malinga to Lee, 2 runs outside off, cut hard off the back foot through third man
Malinga to Lee, no run straight bouncer, Lee sways back again
Malinga to Lee, no run a terrific bouncer which nearly catches the upper edge as Lee shapes to cut off the back foot over gully
Malinga to Lee, 1 run goes for the yorker but Lee reaches out and makes it into a full toss, the outside edge flicking hard down to third man
Malinga to Bracken, no run strikes Bracken with the bouncer, the batsman shaped to duck and it skidded on through to his shoulder
Malinga to Bracken, 1 wide wide down leg this time, no question there
Malinga to Bracken, no run outside off and there was a woody click, but that was bat being stabbed into ground as the ball whistled through, keeping quite low
Kulasekara to Lee, 1 run slower ball, picked, and driven out straight and true to long-off
Kulasekara to Bracken, no run right up there on off, a tight line, and Bracken defends back down
Kulasekara to Bracken, no run a nippy bouncer through outside off, Lee thinks that should have been wide, shaking his head at the other end
Kulasekara to Bracken, no run defended into the covers on the front foot
Kulasekara to Lee, no run short ball on middle, defended sturdily off the back foot

Murali to Bracken, no run round the wicket and a huge shout immediately from Sangakkara, clearing his lungs, as it pitches in line and may have gone on past leg. The umpire shook his head immediately, possibly also for height reasons
Murali to Bracken, no run defended on the front foot this time
Murali to Bracken, 1 run on middle and leg, played off the legs out behind square for a quick single
Murali to Lee, no run this one went straight on and he played inside the line of it, striding right out to defend, almost on the floor, and Sangakkara whips off the bails for insurance
Murali to Lee, no run defended on the front foot, more orthodox this time
Murali to Lee, no run outside off, ripped past him, another play and miss
MKDI Amerasinghe to Bracken, no run good yorker, at 133kph on off, defended forward
MKDI Amerasinghe to Bracken, 1 run low full toss on the legs, tucked off in front of square
MKDI Amerasinghe to Lee, no run on the legs, pushed out to mid-on this time
MKDI Amerasinghe to Lee, no run outside off, close to the inside edge, the batsman whooshing out at it to mid-off
MKDI Amerasinghe to Lee, 1 run on off, driven out wide to mid-on
MKDI Amerasinghe to Bracken, no run outside off, driven into the legs
Kulasekara to Lee, FOUR runs not much wrong with that delivery, but Lee stabs out through third man to bring up the 200
Kulasekara to Lee, no run stabs down on it in defence, a great yorker that one
Kulasekara to Lee, 1 run outside off, a good drive through the covers for one, meaning it's exactly a run a ball required
Kulasekara to Bracken, 1 run outside off, rising and Bracken waits on the back foot, and opens the face to guide the ball to third man
Kulasekara to Lee, no run full delivery on off stump, dug back out to the bowler
Kulasekara to Lee, 1 run yorker, dug out by Lee to the covers
MKDI Amerasinghe to Lee, 1 run yorker on off, clipped out to short midwicket
MKDI Amerasinghe to Bracken, 1 run another yorker, this time slightly outside off, and driven to Jayasuriya at mid-on who would have got him out with a direct hit
MKDI Amerasinghe to Lee, 1 run outside off, cut into the ground off the back foot and they hasten through
MKDI Amerasinghe to Bracken, no run right up there on off, a dot ball builds the pressure there as Bracken defends back into the turf
MKDI Amerasinghe to Bracken, 1 run on the legs, pushes out deep square where Malinga fires it back in

Jayasuriya to Lee, OUT another inspired decision by Jayawardene! Jayasuriya strikes with his first delivery of the match at a crucial time, the batsman trying to pull across the line and he got an inside edge back on to leg stump and all the stumps wobble

Thanks for joining me for this cracker today. Do tune in again on Sunday when we'll be back with coverage of the sold-out first final from the SCG when Australia will take on India while Sri Lanka are leaving on a jet plane... in a few hours. They'll be able to have a cele
"I'm very proud of the time I've had here. The crowd were fantastic, just a shame they've got to leave with a loss. Hopefully this will sharpen us up, it was a reminder."
"It's always painful when you lose, especially when you seemingly have the game in the bag like we did. Sri Lanka bowled well and took the chances when they came."
Great work from the pair who have given so much to the game over so many years.

Jayasuriya loves that, clenching his fist and if that's his last contribution in a game on Australian soil, as it is likely to be, well, that was a fitting ending. What a game at the MCG, it had everything and Sri Lanka are jubilant with their second win of the tournament.
Sri Lanka won by 13 runs
Player of the match is Adam Gilchrist, AUS
